revised_title: The Synthesis and Properties of Boric Ethide
tldr: The authors, Edward Frankland and B. Duppa, discover a new compound called boric ethide through a chemical reaction between zincethyl and tribasic boracic ether. They describe its properties, such as its boiling point, solubility, and reactivity with various substances. They also discuss the formation of diethylate of boric dioxyethide and its properties.
